isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - EST Engine Running Standard Test

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To verify correct operation and specification ranges for engine actuators and electronic sensors. The Electronic Service Tool (EST) signals the Electronic Control Module (ECM) to perform the Key-On Engine-Running Standard Test. The ECM will activate the actuators, monitor sensor feedback signals, and send fault codes for actuators or sensors to the EST.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

note.para: Before running the Key-On Engine-Running Standard Test, set parking brake and make sure the transmission is in neutral.

step1.para: Start and run engine until it reaches 160°F (71°C) minimum.

note.para: Engine coolant temperature must reach 160°F (71°C) minimum for the ECM to accurately test engine actuators and sensors. If engine coolant temperature is below self test range, the EST tool will show ECT Out of Self Test Range.

figure.caption: Key ON Engine Running Standard Test

step1.para: Select the Key-On Engine-Running Standard Test from the Diagnostic drop-down menu.
The ECM will start the Key ON Engine-Running Standard Test and command the engine to accelerate to a predetermined engine rpm and operate the Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) valve.

item.para: Defective or inoperative ICP sensor or IPR valve
Oil leakage in high pressure Injection Control System
Open or shorted wiring harness to ICP or IPR
Loose or corroded engine wiring harness for ICP or IPR
